translation.en: [narrator] A thousand years ago, this land was green and good,

translation.ja: しかしクリスタルが割れた

translation.en: [Stephen] There's so much here that you don't know about.
translation.ja: 知らないことが沢山ある

translation.en: There's an entire world to discover.
translation.ja: 新世界が広がっている

translation.en: [Brian] I was working in London for five years as a jobbing illustrator,
translation.ja: ロンドンで５年間イラストを描いてた

translation.en: and I needed to do my own work, but I didn't know exactly what that was.
translation.ja: 自分の作品を作るにも何をしたいか分からなかった

translation.en: But once I got the opportunity to move to the country here,
translation.ja: ここに引っ越す機会があったデザイナーブライアン･フロウド

translation.en: then, immediately, the first thing I painted
translation.ja: そしてすぐに描いたのが―

translation.en: was, indeed, this picture of a troll with trees behind it
translation.ja: 木を背景にしたトロールだった

translation.en: and a waterfall coming off its nose.
translation.ja: 先端が滝になってる

translation.en: And that's what Jim saw.
translation.ja: それをジムが見た

translation.en: And I was a bit overcome, I think, meeting Jim,
translation.ja: ジムに会って圧倒された

translation.en: and I didn't know quite what to say or how to express myself,
translation.ja: 何というのかうまく言えないけど

translation.en: and it was his leap of faith.
translation.ja: 理屈抜きに信じてくれていた

translation.en: [Cheryl] My father really wanted to do an epic fantasy adventure.
translation.ja: 父は壮大なファンタジーを創りたがってた

translation.en: He really enjoyed doing comedy.
translation.ja: 「セサミストリート」も父は楽しんでたジム･ヘンソン財団シェリル･ヘンソン

translation.en: He enjoyed doing Muppets. He loved Sesame Street.
translation.ja: 「セサミストリート」も父は楽しんでたジム･ヘンソン財団シェリル･ヘンソン 「セサミストリート」も父は楽しんでた

translation.en: He loved the sort of fast, funny, vignette kind of variety show,
translation.ja: 展開が速くて面白いバラエティが好きだったわ

translation.en: but he wanted to do something that really told a complex narrative.
translation.ja: でも もっと複雑な物語を創りたがっていた

translation.en: [Brian] But quite quickly, we were hiring people that had other skills,
translation.ja: すぐに違う技能を持つ人を雇い始めた

translation.en: and Wendy was brought on board specifically for the Gelflings,
translation.ja: ゲルフリンにはウェンディが選ばれた

translation.en: because Jim wanted that strong feminine thing.
translation.ja: ジムが女性らしさを求めたんだ

translation.en: It was all about bringing a character to life, all about creating something you've never seen before
translation.ja: 見たことのない物を作り命を吹き込む

translation.en: that he was hoping the audience would not only believe in,
translation.ja: そして観客に信じてもらうだけでなく

translation.en: but also scratch their heads and go, "How do you do that?"
translation.ja: 〝どうやってる？〞と考えさせる

translation.en: Hang on!
translation.ja: 待って！

translation.en: [Stephen] You have Brian Froud, who is a guy who, for this world, these things are real.
translation.ja: ブライアン･フロウドはこの世界が本物だと信じてる

translation.en: You have Frank Oz, who is one of the most brilliant puppeteers who's ever lived,
translation.ja: フランク･オズは卓越した技能を持つ人形師だ

translation.en: and you have Jim bringing the world-building, and the humanity,
translation.ja: ジムはその世界を作り出し―

translation.en: and the sense of human nature being put into these puppets.
translation.ja: 人形に人間性を吹き込む

translation.en: It's a brilliant kind of creative melting pot that brought the original thing to life.
translation.ja: 優れた創造力のるつぼがオリジナル映画を実現した

translation.en: [Taron] We live in an age of sequels and prequels,
translation.ja: 外伝や続編はよくある

translation.en: but the great thing about The Dark Crystal is
translation.ja: ｢ダーククリスタル｣は世界の縮図だ

translation.en: it's such a microcosmic look at the world that, when you finish watching it,
translation.ja: ｢ダーククリスタル｣は世界の縮図だ 観終えると―

translation.en: you're left with these massive questions
translation.ja: “宇宙とは何か？”という疑問が残る

translation.en: about the universe at large which have never been answered.
translation.ja: “宇宙とは何か？”という疑問が残る 答えがない

translation.en: [Cheryl] There are people who obsess about Dark Crystal, who really care about Dark Crystal,
translation.ja: ｢ダーククリスタル｣に人が魅了され―

translation.en: and over the years, it's really become a cult film.
translation.ja: 時が経つとカルト映画になったの

translation.en: [Stephen] Is there going to be a feature film sequel?
translation.ja: フィーチャー映画の続編は？

translation.en: Is there gonna be an animated TV show?
translation.ja: アニメ番組になる？

translation.en: I don't think that you could have done

translation.en: with the right budget, with the creative team that Henson assembled.
translation.ja: Netflixを使い 予算がありチームを編成できたおかげだ

translation.en: I mean, it's so exciting to see the world come back to life in that way.
translation.ja: こんな形で世界が復活しワクワクした

translation.en: All too often, projects are rebooted or remade based on an IP
translation.ja: 知的財産が理由で計画がよく頓挫する 知的財産が理由で計画がよく頓挫するネットフリックスディレクターテッド･ビアセリ

translation.en: where all the DNA of that thing that makes people love it is discarded.
translation.ja: ネットフリックスディレクターテッド･ビアセリ人が好きな作品のＤＮＡが抜かれてしまう 人が好きな作品のＤＮＡが抜かれてしまう

translation.en: But, for me, if you're going to remake or reboot a franchise,
translation.ja: でも僕に言わせればリメイクするなら―

translation.en: go back to why people like it in the first place.
translation.ja: そのＤＮＡを出すべきだ

translation.en: [Cindy] Teddy Biaselli had told me that Henson were interested in doing an animated series of The Dark Crystal,
translation.ja: ヘンソンがアニメ版を作りたがってると聞いたの

translation.en: and I thought about it, and I went home and I watched the movie again.
translation.ja: 家に帰って映画を見て考えてみた

translation.en: I kept thinking about it. I was, like, "Well the mythology is great,
translation.ja: すばらしい神話ではある

translation.en: but what makes it really special and transcendent is the puppets."
translation.ja: でも 抜群に目を引くのは人形だった

translation.en: [Ted] I picked up the phone. I was, like, "Okay, good news, bad news.
translation.ja: 電話で こう伝えた

translation.en: Uh, bad news is, we're not gonna make The Dark Crystal animated series.
translation.ja: 〝残念だがアニメ版は作れない〞

translation.en: The good news is Cindy wants to know what it would cost to do it live-action."
translation.ja: 〝でも実写映画ならいくらかかる？〞

translation.en: And you could hear the phone hit the floor.
translation.ja: 電話が床に落ちた音が聞こえた

translation.en: And we were shocked.
translation.ja: たまげたわ

translation.en: [laughs] Like, "Really? A series that looks like the film?"
translation.ja: 〝人形劇シリーズ？〞

translation.en: And, of course... of course we immediately responded
translation.ja: もちろん即答したわ

translation.en: that it's yes, like, it's technically possible, but it will be very expensive.
translation.ja: 技術的にはできるけど費用がかさむと

translation.en: [Cindy] The best version of The Dark Crystal that could be made today,
translation.ja: 過去最高の「ダーククリスタル」は―

translation.en: would be made by the Henson Company,
translation.ja: ヘンソン･カンパニーの作品

translation.en: by giving them the freedom
translation.ja: 自由を与えることで

translation.en: to really reach for the best version they can possibly imagine.
translation.ja: 最高の可能性を引き出すことができる

translation.en: -[gasps] -[laughs] Gelfling!
translation.ja: ゲルフリン！

translation.en: And they picked up a teaser, a test,

translation.en: to see what it looked like.
translation.ja: どうなるか見たの

translation.en: [Lisa] Netflix could look at the test and see the same thing that we saw in it.
translation.ja: それを見たNetflixも私達と同じ意見だった

translation.en: So what we had tried to do in the test
translation.ja: テストで撮影したのは―

translation.en: was we did CG Gelfling with puppet Skeksis.
translation.ja: ＣＧのゲルフリンと人形のスケクシス

translation.en: Trespasser!

translation.en: [Andy] Does it make sense to do a TV show in the same way that they did the original film?
translation.ja: オリジナル映画と同じ方法で作るべきか？

translation.en: You know, how much has, of-- has technology progressed?
translation.ja: 技術は進化してるのに？ 技術は進化してるのに？ＣＧ監修アンディ･ハーグリーブス 技術は進化してるのに？

translation.en: [Skeksis] What's that smell?
translation.ja: 何の臭いだ？

translation.en: There's something disparate
translation.ja: 全く違うんだ

translation.en: between a real tactile object that catches the light, that is layered and textured,
translation.ja: 物体に光が当たった時の重なり方や質感は―

translation.en: versus something that is generated in a computer.
translation.ja: コンピュータ生成とは違う

translation.en: And no matter how good it looks, no matter how good it looks, they looked like two different mediums.
translation.ja: どれだけよく出来ても違いが顕著に見える

translation.en: [Lisa] We could make a clean marriage between the two. And, technically, it could be done,
translation.ja: 二つをきれいに融合できる技術はあるけど

translation.en: but the CG Gelfling didn't look like Gelflings.
translation.ja: ＣＧではゲルフリンらしくない

translation.en: [Ritamarie] No matter what you did with the eyes of the puppet,
translation.ja: 人形の目に何をしても―

translation.en: those puppet glass eyes were so hard to replicate
translation.ja: 人形のガラスの目を再現するのが難しい 人形のガラスの目を再現するのが難しいプロデューサーリタ･ペルギ 人形のガラスの目を再現するのが難しい

translation.en: in a CG environment, that you immediately could see
translation.ja: ＣＧ環境ではＣＧと人形の差が―

translation.en: that it was CG talking to the puppet,
translation.ja: すぐに分かってしまう

translation.en: then you really just wanted to see the puppet.
translation.ja: 人形を見たいのに

translation.en: [Erik] Seeing the tests that they did before the shoot with full CGI character and a puppet,
translation.ja: ＣＧと人形で撮影開始前にテストを見たところ―

translation.en: it was... I mean, it's like night and day.
translation.ja: 全く違っていた

translation.en: It's amazing how much more evocative the... the puppet is.
translation.ja: 撮影監督エリック･ウィルソン人形の方が想像力を刺激する

translation.en: [Alice] As masterful as it is, you can't talk to a Pixar character in the real world.
translation.ja: ピクサーの登場人物と現実では話せない

translation.en: I mean, the percentage of the audience that gets to come
translation.ja: 実際そうする人が少なくても 人形には―

translation.en: and talk to a puppet in the real world is very small,

translation.en: but I think you know that you could.

translation.ja: 遡って物語を伝えるのに大切なのは―

translation.ja: 楽しいだけではなく

translation.en: let's-- how much more effects can we do?"

translation.en: [Andy] CG, they can expand your world, they can enhance it and augment it,
translation.ja: ＣＧでは世界を広げ強化や補足ができ―

translation.en: and they can totally take it to places that just sets can't and just puppets can't,

translation.en: but they can't be the star of the show, and they shouldn't be the star,

translation.ja: ウインクや笑顔を追加してみた

translation.en: and just take the performance from the puppet just that little bit further to add a bit more life to it.
translation.ja: それで人形の演技にもっと息吹を吹き込める

translation.ja: キラの顔を少し補うと―

translation.ja: 過去最大の人形製作をやることになった

translation.en: This has no humans, so it is a complete puppet extravaganza.

translation.ja: ジム･ヘンソンのビジョンを―

translation.ja: すばらしいアイデアを出してくる

translation.ja: 自由に創作することができた

translation.ja: 「ダーククリスタル」では

translation.ja: 少し危険な異世界だった

translation.ja: アンブリン映画を見せる

translation.ja: 子供の頃に見た「ダーククリスタル」も

translation.ja: それで恐ろしさも和らぐかも

translation.ja: 最高の創造力を様々な人に発揮させた

translation.ja: オリジナル映画と同じ方法で作った

translation.ja: 本物を作るとコミットしていた

translation.ja: 35年前にジムがした事は―

translation.ja: 彼の功績の中でも卓越したものだった

translation.ja: いくつもの人形もあり―
